examples: He dimmed the lights and put on soft music.
The lights dimmed briefly when the air conditioning was turned on.

definitions.definition: To render dim, obscure, or dark; to make less bright or distinct.
To deprive of distinct vision; to hinder from seeing clearly, either by dazzling or clouding the eyes; to darken the senses or understanding of.

examples: All these setbacks had started to dim the hopes of the students.
Nothing will dim their spirit of resilience.
A glut might dim the outlook for grain futures.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make something less bright .
secondary_definitions: To render dim, obscure, or dark; to make less bright or distinct.
To deprive of distinct vision; to hinder from seeing clearly, either by dazzling or clouding the eyes; to darken the senses or understanding of.
( figurative ) To diminish , dull , or curtail .
